CVE-2007-6504.title: Hosting Controller iibind.asp header injection
CVE-2007-6504.body: Hosting Controller is vulnerable to header injection, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the iibind.asp script. By sending a specially-crafted request using unspecified attack vectors, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject arbitrary HTTP headers and HTTP body data, which will allow the attacker to conduct various attacks against the vulnerable system, including cross-site scripting, cache poisoning or session hijacking.Apply the patch for this vulnerability (Post-Hotfix 3.3 Security Patch), available from the Hosting Controller Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-6508.title: xeCMS view.php directory traversal
CVE-2007-6508.body: xeCMS could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the view.php script containing URL-encoded "dot dot" sequences (..%2F) in the list parameter to view arbitrary files on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-6509.title: Appian BPMS packet handling denial of service
CVE-2007-6509.body: Appian Business Process Management Suite (BPMS) is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by improper handling of malformed packets. By sending a series of specially-crafted packets to a vulnerable system, a remote attacker could cause the application to crash.Apply the patch for this vulnerability. See References.

CVE-2007-6513.title: HP eSupportDiagnostics ActiveX control information disclosure
CVE-2007-6513.body: The HP eSupportDiagnostics ActiveX control (hpediag.dll) could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the use of the insecure fileUtil() and regUtil() methods. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web page, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to read arbitrary files and registry information.No remedy available as of July 6, 2008.

CVE-2007-6514.title: Apache HTTP Server Windows SMB shares information disclosure
CVE-2007-6514.body: Apache HTTP Server could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the improper matching of file extensions with the correct engines. By sending a specially-crafted request for files hosted via a Windows fileshare that is mounted with an sufficiently dated version of Samba, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to view arbitrary files in plaintext and obtain sensitive information.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-6515.title: SiteScape Forum HTTP request command execution
CVE-2007-6515.body: SiteScape Forum could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the dispatch.cgi script. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability and enter commands separated by a semicolon (;) character to execute arbitrary commands on the Web server.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available to registered customers from the SiteScape Forum Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-6516.title: RavWare Software RavFLIC ActiveX control FileName() buffer overflow
CVE-2007-6516.body: The RavWare Software RavFLIC ActiveX control (masflc.ocx) is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the FileName() method. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page that passes an overly long string to the FileName() method, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim or cause the victim's browser to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-6518.title: Woltlab Burning Board Lite search.php SQL injection
CVE-2007-6518.body: Woltlab Burning Board Lite is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the search.php script using the showposts, sortby or sortorder parameters, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-6520.title: Opera Web browser plugins security bypass
CVE-2007-6520.body: Opera Web browser could allow a remote attacker to bypass cross-domain security restrictions, caused by an unspecified error related to specific plugins. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could use certain plugins to bypass same origin policy restrictions and gain unauthorized access to other domains. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to possibly perform cross-site scripting attacks and launch further attacks on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of Opera (9.25 or later), available from the Opera Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-6521.title: Opera Web browser TLS certificate code execution
CVE-2007-6521.body: The Opera Web browser could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an unspecified error when handling TLS certificates. By sending a specially-crafted TLS certificate, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of Opera (9.25 or later), available from the Opera Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-6522.title: Opera Web browser plugins security bypass
CVE-2007-6522.body: Opera Web browser could allow a remote attacker to bypass cross-domain security restrictions, caused by an unspecified error related to specific plugins. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could use certain plugins to bypass same origin policy restrictions and gain unauthorized access to other domains. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to possibly perform cross-site scripting attacks and launch further attacks on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of Opera (9.25 or later), available from the Opera Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-6524.title: Opera Web browser bitmaps information disclosure
CVE-2007-6524.body: Opera Web browser could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an unspecified error when processing bitmaps. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to display random memory data and other sensitive information.Upgrade to the latest version of Opera (9.25 or later), available from the Opera Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-6527.title: PunBB Automatic Image Upload with Thumbnails module uploadimg.php file upload
CVE-2007-6527.body: The PunBB Automatic Image Upload with Thumbnails module could allow a remote attacker to upload arbitrary files, caused by improper validation of file extensions by the uploadimg.php script. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP request with a forged MIME type header, a remote attacker could upload a malicious file, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system or inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed, in order to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-6533.title: Zoom Player error message function buffer overflow
CVE-2007-6533.body: Zoom Player is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by an unspecified function when handling error messages. By persuading a victim to open a PLS file containing an overlong file name via a HTTP link in a specially-crafted ZPL file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-6535.title: Yahoo Toolbar YShortcut ActiveX control buffer overflow
CVE-2007-6535.body: The Yahoo Toolbar YShortcut ActiveX control (YShortcut.dll) is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the IsTaggedBM() method. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page that passes an overly long string to the IsTaggedBM() method, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim or cause the victim's browser to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-6536.title: Google Toolbar custom button installer domain spoofing
CVE-2007-6536.body: Google Toolbar could allow a remote attacker to spoof domain names in the custom button installer. By persuading a victim to add a custom button by opening a specially-crafted URI containing an open redirector, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to spoof domain names or conduct phishing attacks.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-6538.body: The MRBS module for Moodle is vulnerable to SQL injection. CVE-2007-6539.title: iSupport index.php file include
CVE-2007-6539.body: iSupport could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. CVE-2007-6543.body: eSyndiCat Link Exchange is vulnerable to SQL injection. CVE-2007-6545.title: RunCMS index.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-6545.body: RunCMS is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php script. CVE-2007-6545.body: RunCMS is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the edituser.php script. CVE-2007-6550.body: PMOS Help Desk could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by the failure to restrict access to current users by the form.php script. CVE-2007-6551.title: MailMachinePRO showMsg.php SQL injection
CVE-2007-6551.body: MailMachinePRO is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the showMsg.php script using the id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of MailMachinePRO (2.2.6 or later), available from the MailMachinePRO Web site. CVE-2007-6553.title: TeamCal Pro lang parameter file include
CVE-2007-6553.body: TeamCal Pro could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php, register.php, login.php or statistics.php script using the lang parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote or the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-6554.title: TeamCal Pro lang parameter file include
CVE-2007-6554.body: TeamCal Pro could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php, register.php, login.php or statistics.php script using the lang parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote or the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Logaholic (2.0 RC8 or later), available from the Logaholic Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-6593.body: The Autonomy (formerly Verity) KeyView Viewer, Filter, and Export SDK, which is used in IBM Lotus Notes and possibly other applications, is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow in the Lotus 1-2-3 file viewer (l123sr.dll), caused by improper bounds checking of Lotus 1-2-3 (.123) files. By persuading a victim to view a specially-crafted .123 file using one of the affected file viewers, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the victim's application to crash.Refer to IBM Technote (FAQ) 1285600 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2007-6708.title: Linksys WAG54GS Wireless-G ADSL Gateway setup.cgi cross-site request forgery
CVE-2007-6708.body: The Linksys WAG54GS Wireless-G ADSL Gateway is vulnerable to a cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by setup.cgi. By persuading a victim with administrative privileges to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could send a malformed POST request to the mtenRestore or sysname parameter to cause the victim to restore factory defaults, create user accounts, and possibly perform other arbitrary administrative tasks. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning and other malicious activities.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-6709.title: Linksys WAG54GS Wireless-G ADSL Gateway default admin account
CVE-2007-6709.body: The Linksys WAG54GS Wireless-G ADSL Gateway has a default administrative account. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain complete administrative control over the Web management console of the affected device.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-6711.title: FreeWebshop.org customer.php unauthorized access
CVE-2007-6711.body: FreeWebshop.org could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system, caused by an unspecified error in the customer.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using unknown attack vectors to gain administrator privileges.Upgrade to the latest version of FreeWebshop.org (2.2.7_R1 or later), available from the FreeWebshop.org Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-6712.title: Linux kernel hrtimer_forward denial of service
CVE-2007-6712.body: Linux kernel, when running on a 64-bit system, is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an integer overflow error in the hrtimer_forward function. By using a timer with a large expiry value that causes constant time expiration, a local attacker could cause the application to enter into an infinite loop resulting in a denial of service.Apply the patch for this vulnerability (b/kernel/hrtimer.c), available from the Linux kernel GIT Repository. See References.

CVE-2007-6714.title: DBMail authldap security bypass
CVE-2007-6714.body: DBMail could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error in authldap. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a NULL password to bind to an LDAP server that supports anonymous logins.Upgrade to the latest version of DBMail (2.2.9 or later), available from the DBMail Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-6717.title: IBM AIX bos.net.tcp.client tftp buffer overflow
CVE-2007-6717.body: IBM AIX is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in the tftp bos.net.tcp.client. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability using unknown attack vectors to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with root privileges.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-6726.title: Dojo xip_client.html and xip_server.html cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-6726.body: Dojo, as used in Apache Struts, is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using unspecified vectors related to xip_client.html and xip_server.html to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Dojo (0.4.3 or later), available from the Dojo Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-6750.title: Apache HTTP Server HTTP request denial of service
CVE-2007-6750.body: Apache HTTP Server is vulnerable to a denial of service. By sending specially-crafted partial HTTP requests, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a daemon outage.Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2007-6751.title: MailForm plugin for Movable Type cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-6751.body: The MailForm plugin for Movable Type is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unspecified parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Movable Type (1.20 or later), available from the Movable Type Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-4734.title: OtsTurntables M3U buffer overflow
CVE-2007-4734.body: OtsTurntables is vulnerable to a buffer overflow. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted M3U file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-4735.title: Virtual DJ M3U buffer overflow
CVE-2007-4735.body: Virtual DJ is vulnerable to a buffer overflow. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted M3U file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-5037.title: inotify-tools inotifytools_snprintf() buffer overflow
CVE-2007-5037.body: inotify-tools is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the inotifytools_snprintf() function. By sending an overly long filename, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with privileges of the application using the library or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of inotify-tools (3.11 or later), available from Sourceforge.net: Files. See References.

CVE-2007-5062.title: Flip account.php unauthorized access
CVE-2007-5062.body: Flip could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system. By sending a specially-crafted request to the account.php script using the op parameter, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to create an admin account and gain unauthorized admin privileges on the application.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-5252.title: NetSupport Manager Client and NetSupport School Student unspecified denial of service
CVE-2007-5252.body: NetSupport Manager Client and NetSupport School Student are vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an unspecified vulnerability. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to disrupt the connection, resulting in a denial of service.Refer to NetSupport Technical Document: TD545 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information.

CVE-2007-5313.title: Picturesolution config.php file include
CVE-2007-5313.body: Picturesolution could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the config.php script using the path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-5342.title: Apache Tomcat JULI logging weak security
CVE-2007-5342.body: Apache Tomcat could provide weaker than expected security, caused by the improper restricting of JULI logging configurations by the default security policy. A remote attacker could exploit this weakness using third party Web applications to create or overwrite files on the system with the privileges of Apache TomcatApply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the Apache-SVN Repository. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2007-5465.title: doop CMS index.php file include
CVE-2007-5465.body: doop CMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script using the page parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-5819.title: IBM Tivoli Continuous Data Protection for Files weak security
CVE-2007-5819.body: IBM Tivoli Continuous Data Protection for Files could provide weaker than expected security, caused by the improper permissions on the CDP global download directory. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions and distribute malicious files.Refer to IBM APAR IC54264 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-5848.title: Apple Mac OS X CUPS buffer overflow
CVE-2007-5848.body: Apple Mac OS X is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the printer driver for CUPS. By passing a specially-crafted URI to the CUPS service, a local attacker with administrative privileges could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with SYSTEM privileges.Apply Apple Security Update 2007-009 v1.1, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-5956.title: IBM Informix Dynamic Server DBLANG directory traversal
CVE-2007-5956.body: IBM Informix Dynamic Server could allow a local attacker to traverse directories and gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by improper validation of the DBLANG environment variable. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain root privileges on the system by using an unspecified setuid binary to set the DBLANG variable to a specially-crafted value containing "dot dot" (../) sequences.Upgrade to the latest version of IBM Informix Dynamic Server (10.00.xC7W1 or later), available from the IBM Support & downloads Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-5988.title: BtiTracker shoutbox security bypass
CVE-2007-5988.body: BtiTracker could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by the improper checking of user credentials by the shoutbox. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions and post random shoutbox entries without having any valid user credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of BtiTracker (1.4.5 or later), available from the SourceForge.net: Files. See References.

CVE-2007-6013.title: Wordpress authentication cookie password weak security
CVE-2007-6013.body: Wordpress authentication cookies could provide weaker than expected security. Authentication cookies are based on the MD5 hash of the password MD5 hash, which is stored in the user database. A remote attacker with read access to the user database could exploit this vulnerability to bypass authentication and gain unauthorized administrative access to the application by generating an authentication cookie using the password MD5 hash recovered from the database.Upgrade to the latest version of Wordpress (2.5.1 or later), available from the Wordpress Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-6038.body: The JUser component for Joomla! could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the xajax_functions.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-6041.title: Rigs of Rods Sequencer::queueMessage() buffer overflow
CVE-2007-6041.body: Rigs of Rods is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of the MSG2_USE_VEHICLE parameter by Sequencer::queueMessage() function. By joining a game server with an overly long vehicle name, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and cause the server to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Rigs of Rods (0.33d-SP1 or later), available from the Rigs of Rods Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-6089.title: meBiblio index.php file include
CVE-2007-6089.body: meBiblio could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script using the action parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of meBiblio (0.4.6 or later), available from the meBiblio Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-6128.title: WorkingOnWeb events.php SQL injection
CVE-2007-6128.body: WorkingOnWeb is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the events.php script using the idevent parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-6192.title: Citrix NetScaler Web management interface information disclosure
CVE-2007-6192.body: Citrix NetScaler could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. The Web management interface stores user credentials within a cookie using weak encryption. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a known-plaintext attack to capture a cookie and obtain cleartext credentials and other sensitive information.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-6266.title: bcoos index.php and ratephoto.php SQL injection
CVE-2007-6266.body: bcoos is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php or ratephoto.php script using the gid or lid parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-6478.title: Rosoft Media Player m3u playlist buffer overflow
CVE-2007-6478.body: Rosoft Media Player is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when processing .M3U files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .M3U playlist, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.

CVE-2007-6485.title: Oreon and Centreon fileOreonConf file include
CVE-2007-6485.body: Oreon and Centreon could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the MakeXML.php or MakeXML4statusCounter.php script using the fileOreonConf parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.
